question: Which of the following was the extent of Indus Valley Civilization?
option3: Afghanistan, Sind, Punjab, Rajasthan, Gujarat and Kashmir
explanation: The Indus Valley Civilization was not confined to these few sites. The influence of this culture extended to the Punjab, Sindh, North West Frontier Province (now in Pakistan), Baluchistan, Rajasthan, U.P., Gujarat and even some parts of south India.
